title: It was not always in the East - Where Germany votes for the right-wing.
description: It's a common these that mostly in Eastern Germany people vote for right wing parties. To show the development over the last years, we created an interactive map that shows the results of elections on a highly detailed level. To give deeper insights, the visualisation differentiates right wing parties are classified as extreme right or right populist.

title: Federal Election in Germany
description: An interactive chart that shows the development of election polls in Germany over the last couple of years.

title: Going for Growth
description: Based on the data of OECD's 'Going for Growth' report 2017, this interactive map shows structural reforms in different countries.

title: The Best of 2016
description: Detailed overview about a selection of the NZZ editors' favourite articles written in 2016 with comments.

title: PISA 2015
description: This interactive map let's the user explore the results of the PISA report 2015 by OECD and provides detailed information about the different indicators per country.

title: Berlin Coalition Agreement
description: By visually highlighting important sections and providing additional information, the agreement becomes more compehensible.

title: Berlin's Representatives
description: An overview of the newly elected representatives that can be filtered by different parameters like age, district or political experience.

title: Berlin Marathon
description: Displaying all runners of the Berlin Marathon 2016, this map unfolds the detailed course of the race.

title: Berlin Election 2016
description: This map breaks down the results of the 2016 election in Berlin and provides detailed information on ward level.

title: The formula for electoral victory
description: To show the conditions that help parties to win an election, we created a decision-tree-like visualisation with the Berliner Morgenpost.

title: Voters transition in Berlin
description: This interactive sankey chart gives insights into the migration of voters in Berlin during the 2016 election.

title: These candidates live furthest away from their voters
description: Some of the candidates for the Berlin House of Representatives live far away from their election district. This project shows, who they are.

title: Huh!
description: Support Iceland, the underdog of EURO16, with a 'Huh!'

title: Slow travel in Switzerland
description: Set a starting point for your trip in Switzerland and find out how far you can travel in an hour on your bike or walking.

title: Your quickest way to the lake
description: A useful map that helps Berliners to find the quickest way from any starting point in the city to the closest lake.

title: Who will win the European Championship?
description: The NZZ Championship Oracle is a data-driven application that was created for the European Championship 2016. Based on different parameters that can be set by the user, the app creates a prediction for the possible outcome of the Championship. The algorithm for the calculation of the result can be found on github.

title: These are Germany's greenest cities
description: An analysis of satellite images of Germany helped to create a ranking of the greenest cities in the country and a beautiful map.

title: How are refugee routes to Europe changing?
description: Have a look at this timeline to see the correlations between political events and migrants' paths to Europe on a map.

title: That is how Swiss universities are linked to third parties
description: A lot of universities in Switzerlanf maintain relationships to third party influencers. This visualisation shows all the links between universities and professors to companies. It gives an overview about the relations in each university and detailed information about each connection.

title: Who is fighting whom in Syria?
description: This simplufied visualization shows the complexity of the situation in Syria.

title: This is how refugees live in Berlin
description: A VR project that shows different accomodations for refugees in Berlin.

title: Cycleway Check
description: Inspired by the idea to establish cycleways in Berlin's main streets by referendum, this map shows where bike path's are missing.

title: In the Streets of Zurich
description: This tool let's you explore each of Zurich's 2505 streets and gives information about its name and history.

title: Where do Berliners really come from?
description: Native Berliners are a minority in Germany's capital. This map helps you to find out, where people living in Berlin really come from.

title: UN Climate Change Conference: The Factions
description: The 195 states participating in the Paris climate change conference have different interests. This visualization shows you, what they are.

title: Berlin’s new Skyline - Where the city grows in height
description: To show how fast Berlin is growing, we created an interactive 3D map of the city. It let's you explore the plans for new buildings and gives you an idea of how Berlin will change. Also, you can go on a time travel tour through town and compare the skylines of 1990, today and the future.

title: Einheitsreise
description: More than 25 years ago Germany was reunited. Have a look at this interactive journey, to see how united the country is today.

title: Noise-map Berlin - How noisy is your neighbourhood?
description: The noise level in some parts of Berlin is designated hazardous to health. In this project we created a detailed interactive map of the city that shows where the noise level is particularly high at a glance. It also provides detailed information about the different sources of noise such as road traffic, public transportation and airplanes.

title: Where is Germany receiving refugees?
description: A data visualiszation that shows where the refugees in Germany come from and where they're accommodated.

title: Refugees in Berlin
description: In 2016, there were less refugees in Berlin than before the refugee crisis. This set of graphics gives you detailed insights.

title: 10 out of 800,000
description: In this project, ten of the thousands of refugees living in Berlin and Brandenburg are telling their stories.

title: This is how long you have to pay for a freehold flat
description: Using this tool, you can calculate the amount of time needed to pay for your appartment by setting your income and the flat size.

title: Where Europe's populatin grows and shrinks
description: This map of Europe shows information about the population on a very detailed level and helps to compare countries based on different indicators.

title: Champions League 2015
description: See the players of the two teams playing the Champions League 2015 final at a glance and rank them by various parameters.

title: D3-extended
description: Extend the famous d3 library for data visualizations with useful jQuery-like helper functions.

title: The End of World War II in Berlin
description: Survivors are telling how they experienced the end of WWII in Berlin.

title: Berlin 1945 and today
description: See how Berlin has changed since the end of World War II by playing around with this intercative photo gallery.

title: Flat Prices in Berlin - Where can you afford to live?
description: This project shows a personalized Berlin map of areas you can afford to live in.

title: TTIP - The Deal
description: An intercative analyss of the TTIP dealers makes their background more transparent.

title: Party Donations
description: In 2013 companies have donated 24 million euros to parties. This chart shows who gave how much money to whom.

title: Measles in Berlin
description: How have measles spread in Berlin during the last outbreak? This graphic gives you an overview.

title: istderberschonfertig.de
description: Visit the continuously updated page to stay informed about the construction progress of the Berlin airport.

title: React Starterkit
description: A lightweight starting point for webapplications using React.

title: Interactive Police-Ticker
description: This projects shows an attempt for a concept to present police reports on a news site.

title: Anxiety Disorders in Europe
description: Germany ranks amongst the top states when it comes to anxiety disorders in Europe. This map helps to compare between all countries.

title: That's how rents in Berlin rise
description: Rents are increasing everywhere. This chart shows the development in the German capital since 2009.

title: M29 - The Bus Line of Varieties
description: This interactive takes you on a journey through the German capital in Berlins most famous bus line.

title: #DDJ Catalogue
description: A growing and regularly updated collection of data-driven journalism projects from Germany.

title: The Unseen
description: In this multimedia project homeless people living in Berlin are telling their stories.

title: Native and New Berliners
description: A data-analysis shows in which parts of town native and new Berliners live and how the S-Bahn ring divides the city.

title: The Scar of the City
description: 1989 and today - Discover what's left of the Berlin Wall in this interactive tour through the capital.

title: Berlin Iconfont
description: This custom iconfont makes it easy to include the shapes of Berlin districts in your project.

title: Car Atlas
description: The distribution of cars in Germany visualized on an interactive map.

title: Crime in Berlin - How dangerous is your neighbourhood?
description: In 2013 more than 500.000 crimes were reported in Berlin. Use this map to see where they took place.

title: Tempelhofer Feld
description: This 3D visualization shows what the Berlin senate is planning to build on the area of the Tempelhofer Feld.

title: Flight Routes Radar
description: Discover where the paths of low altitude flights run through Berlin.

title: Where can you afford to live in Berlin?
description: This map of Berlin tells you how much money you have to spend on living in differnet areas of the city.

title: Fine Dust Monitor
description: Based on data from eleven measure in Berlin, these self-updating visualizations show the concentration of fine dust in the city.
